page.title: 03Leighton Farm Estate
page.content: { This splendid farm of John Naylor's was considered one of the most modern of its time.When we visited it recently we could still see the ruins or remains of the modern engineering as in 1851.Water was dammed and channelled to drive a turbine at the farm.This powered machines in the mill,and sheep shearing implements.We saw the water-pipes,the round piggeries,the rail tracks which carried trucks of fodder into the sheds.Even the huge barn doors worked on a pulley system. Gas was provided for the Hall and the Church by the gasworks Up on Moel-y-Mab,600ft. above river level we can still see a great tank where liquid manure was made. There is a funicular railway bridge which is in a serious state of dis-repair.
